main.description: Now I am pursuing my masterâ€™s degree in Information systems, and expecting to graduate in May 2022. I am actively working towards becoming a competitive software engineer
main.bio: A self-motivated professional with a great passion in software development, demonstrated to be a fast learner and a team player. For the past several years, I have been working in building algorithms and methods for the healthcare and bioengineering industry, improving sensitivity and accuracy for identifying specific pathological patterns. I have in-depth knowledge and hands-on experience in Java and JavaScript programming, relational & non-relational databases, Linux, and network fundamentals.
main.contactmessage: Drop me an email if you would like to find out if I am a fit to the engineer role you are looking for

resume.skillmessage: Languages: Java, Javascript, Swift, SQL, Python, HTML, CSS, Matlab Tools, frameworks and technologies: MySQL, SQL Server, Xcode, IntelliJ, MongoDB, AWS, React, JavaFX, Swing, XChart, Tableau, PowerBI, Git, Linux, iOS, TCP/IP, HTTP

education.description: Related courses: Data Mgt and Database Design, OOD in Java, Web Design, Data Structure and Algorithms, Smartphone-based Web Development, etc. GPA: 3.9/4.0 (Running total)

education.school: West China School of Medicine, Sichuan University

work.company: Department of Bioengineering, Eye Institute at Harborview Medical Center, University of Washington
work.title: Visiting Scientist and Senior Research Fellow
work.description: Designed and implemented algorithms in Matlab for quantification of angiographic morphologic changes in retinal vein occlusion, tested and applied a novel method of attenuation correction on SS-OCT structural scans to facilitate accurate automatic segmentation of the choroid. Designed and implemented algorithms in Python for automated detection of vascular branching characteristics in fundus images, and improved semi-auto segmentation algorithms for volumetric retinal OCT images. Co-designed a clinical prototype of a miniature hand-held optical coherence tomography probe for prematurity and pediatric ophthalmic imaging.
